words: Ben	ni-wa 		mû-anka 	wiîgue 	a-kî-buut-ag-îr-a 			thaa 	ino
translation: Ben MUST be swimming (right now)

words: N’wa		mwanka	wîgue	Ben	akîbuutagîra			thaa	ino.
gloss: Ni-wa		mû-anka	wîgue	Ben	a-kî-buut-ag-îr-a		thaa	ino
translation: Ben MUST be swimming (right now)
comment: Natural as a response to “What is Ben doing right now?”

words: Ni-wa		mû-anka	wîgue	mû-biira	û-ri	C
translation: it MUST be in C
“It is likely that Ann is at the lake”
The teacher is likely to come
The teacher may come or not.

words: N’-wa		wigue 	mû-arimû 	a-ka-y-a, 	            kana 	a-ti-y-a.
translation: The teacher may come or not.

words: Ka-baka ni-wa 		u-îgue 		ka-rî 	ny-omba 	kana 	û-ka-îgua 	ka-rî 	n-ja
translation: “The cat may be inside or outside.”
Ann may  be in the lake.

words: Ti-wa                 mû-anka         u-îgue         Mary         a-rî         mû-ciî
translation: it is NOT CERTAIN that she is at home.

words: Ti racima wîgue Mary arî mûciî.
translation: it is NOT CERTAIN that she is at home.
Ben CAN’T be at home.
it MUST NOT be in C.
You MUST wear a helmet.
I am supposed to wear a helmet.
You may/can enter.

“You can enter”
“(I will) let you enter”
You can stay overnight or you can go home.

words: Ti racima û-îkîr-e                 n-guo                 ci-a                 û-bici
translation: I don’t have to wear formal clothes.
comment: Not a must that you wear official clothes.

words: Ti-wa 		mû-anka 	û-îkîr-e 		n-guo ci-a û-bici
translation: I don’t have to wear formal clothes.
comment: Not a must that you wear official clothes.

translation: You are not riding a motorbike without a helmet.
You are not riding a motorbike without a helmet.

words: A-geni   ba-ti-ka-kiny-ith-i-e    thaa  kûmi  na ci-îrî  kû-kû
translation: Visitors should not be here after 6:00pm.
You must follow this road.
You can use this road.
You must follow this road.

words: Team 	A 	n-’wa 		î-tur-ire 	Team 	B.
translation: Team A HAS TO beat Team B.

words: Team 	A 	n-’wa 		mwanka  	î-tur-ire 	Team 	B.
translation: Team A HAS TO beat Team B.
Let him/her use a bus.
S/he can use a bus.
You can use a bus or a bicycle.
comment: without n’wa we don’t get the “can” meaning, it’s more like an instruction

translation: Not a must that you use a bus.
Not a must that you use a bus.
You don’t use another path to go to B.

words: Û-ti-ûmba                 kû-tûmîr-a        n-jira        î-ngî        kû-thi         B
translation: You can’t use another path to go to B.
You shall not use another path to go to B.
comment: not felicitous in the given context… suggests that there is another road, but sb. advises you to not to take another road.

translation: I must/have to sneeze.
I must/have to sneeze.

words: Mî-tî 	ya 	duku 	ni-wa 		î-kûr-e 		Indonesia
translation: Duku trees can grow in Indonesia.
Duku trees grow in Indonesia

words: Kirimi	ni-wa-ruge 		chapati 	indî 	a-ti-rî 		na 	i-nto 	bi-a 	kû-ruga
translation: Kirimi can cook chapati but, unfortunately, he doesn't have the ingredients.
Let Kirimi cook chapati
Not a must that the mountain erupts (lit:explode).
Not a must that the mountain erupts (lit:explode).

words: Mî-tî 	î-a 	Duku 	î-ti-ûmba 	kû-kûr-a 	Indonesia
translation: Duku trees can’t grow in Indonesia.
I must/have to buy this cup.
I must/have to buy this cup.
